critique: This document is a straightforward administrative order designating Lawrenceburg, Indiana, as a customs port of entry. It also includes the adjoining town of Greendale within the port's limits. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy stance, expansion of executive power, or any implications for national security vs. civil liberties. It doesn't touch on economic regulation or social inclusion either. The federalism aspect is neutral as it simply designates a port within an existing customs district.
